instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a  20v 03-04amps
threads.message:
hello my problem is  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short when check in diode mode.  
 and <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL> upon voltage check  no output voltage.

maybe cpu prob or maybe not the cpu..

thanks advice me...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a  20v 03-04amps
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Short to ground on L7690, will block <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>.
Best way to find the culprit is voltage injection.
Start with 1V and slowly increase (only if needed), no more than 4V.
First, set the amp limit of lab PSU to max.

upon checking 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> inject all temp  cpu

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a  20v 03-04amps
threads.message:
Is the hotest spot on the PCH die?
In such case, changing processor is the only solution.
